00047 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00048 
00049 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00050 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00051 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00052 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00053 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00054 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00055 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00056 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00057 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00058 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00060 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00061 
00062 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00063 
00064 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00065 
00066 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00067 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00068 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00069 
00070 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00071 
00072     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00073 }
00074 
00075 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00076 
00077 {
00078     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00079     spl_t flags;
00080 
00081     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00082 
00083     adeos_load_cpuid();
00084 
00085     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00086         {
00087         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00088             /* Use a non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00089                bit_spin_lock. */
00090             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1, lock))
00091                 cpu_relax();
00092         }
00093     else
00094         flags |= 2;
00095 
00096     return flags;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00100 
00101 {
00102     if (!(flags & 2))
00103         {
00104         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00105 
00106         rthal_cli();
00107 
00108         adeos_load_cpuid();
00109 
00110         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00111             {
00112             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00113             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00114             cpu_relax(); /* FIXME: is this really needed ? */
00115             }
00116         }
00117 
00118     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00119 }
00120 
00121 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00122 
00123 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00124 
00125 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00126 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00127 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00128 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00129 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00130 
00131 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00184 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00185 
00186     /* Kernel mode side */
00187 
00188 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00189     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00190        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00191     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00192     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00193 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00194 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00195 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00196 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00197 
00198     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00199     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00200     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00201     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00202 
00203     /* User mode side */
00204     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00205     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00206 
00207     /* Init block */
00208     struct xnthread *self;
00209     int imask;
00210     const char *name;
00211     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00212     void *cookie;
00213 
00214 } xnarchtcb_t;

00242 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00243     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00244 }
00245 
00246 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00247     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00248 }

00250 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00251     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00252 }

00255     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;

00262 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00263 
00264 {
00265 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00266     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00267         return vmalloc(bytes);
00268 #endif
00269 
00270     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00271 }
00272 
00273 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00274 
00275 {
00276 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00277     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00278         vfree(chunk);
00279     else
00280 #endif
00281         kfree(chunk);
00282 }

00299 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00300 
00301 {
00302     spl_t s;
00303     splhigh(s);
00304     splexit(!!imask);
00305     return !!s;
00306 }

00365 
00366 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00367 
00368 {
00369     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00370 
00371     adeos_load_cpuid();
00372 
00373     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00374        and always inside a critical section. */
00375     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00376     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00377     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00378     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00379 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00380     rootcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_task->thread.fpr[0];
00381 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00382 }
00383 
00384 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00385     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00386 }
00387 
00388 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00389                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00390 {
00391     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00392     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00393     unsigned long flags;
00394 
00395     rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00396 
00397     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00398 
00399     if (inproc && inproc != outproc) /* User-space thread switch? */
00400         {
00401         struct mm_struct *prev = outproc->active_mm;
00402         struct mm_struct *next = inproc->active_mm;
00403 
00404         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00405 
00406         inproc->thread.pgdir = next->pgd;
00407 
00408         if (prev != next)
00409             {
00410             get_mmu_context(next);
00411             set_context(next->context, next->pgd);
00412             }
00413 
00414         if (!inproc->mm)
00415             enter_lazy_tlb(prev,inproc);
00416 
00417         /* The following has been lifted from
00418            arch/ppc/kernel/process.c. */
00419 
00420 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00421         if (outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00422             giveup_fpu(outproc);
00423 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00424         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_VEC)))
00425             giveup_altivec(outproc);
00426 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00427 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00428         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_SPE)))
00429             giveup_spe(outproc);
00430 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00431 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00432 
00433 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00434         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_altivec == inproc)
00435             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_VEC;
00436 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00437 
00438 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00439         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_spe == inproc)
00440             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_SPE;
00441 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00442 
00443         _switch(&outproc->thread,&inproc->thread);
00444         }
00445     else
00446         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00447         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00448 
00449     rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00450 }
00451 
00452 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00453                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00454     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00455 }
00456 
00457 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00458     /* Empty */
00459 }
00460 
00461 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00462                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00463                                          const char *name)
00464 {
00465     tcb->user_task = current;
00466     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00467     tcb->ksp = 0;
00468     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00469 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00470     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00471 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00472     tcb->entry = NULL;
00473     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00474     tcb->self = thread;
00475     tcb->imask = 0;
00476     tcb->name = name;
00477 }
00478 
00479 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00480 
00481     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00482     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00483     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00484 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00485     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00486 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00487     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00488 }
00489 
00490 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00491 
00492 {
00493     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00494     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00495     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00496     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00497 }
00498 
00499 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00500                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00501                                        void *cookie,
00502                                        int imask,
00503                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00504                                        char *name)
00505 {
00506     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00507 
00508     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00509 
00510     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00511     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00512     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00513     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00514     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00515     ksp[26] = flags & ~MSR_EE; /* msr */
00516 
00517     tcb->entry = entry;
00518     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00519     tcb->self = thread;
00520     tcb->imask = imask;
00521     tcb->name = name;
00522 }
00523 
00524 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00525 
00526 {
00527 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00528     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00529        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00530     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00531     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00532 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00533 }
00534 
00535 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00536 
00537 {
00538 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00539 
00540     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00541 
00542     if (task)
00543         {
00544         if (task->thread.regs && (task->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00545             giveup_fpu(task);
00546 
00547         return;
00548         }
00549 
00550     /* Save the fp regs of the kernel thread owning the FPU. */
00551 
00552     rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00553 
00554 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00555 }
00556 
00557 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00558 
00559 {
00560 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00561 
00562     if (tcb->user_task)
00563         /* On PowerpPC, we let the unavailability exception happen for
00564            the incoming user-space task if it happens to use the FPU,
00565            instead of eagerly reloading the fp regs upon switch. */
00566         return;
00567 
00568     /* Restore the fp regs of the incoming kernel thread. */
00569 
00570     rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00571 
00572 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00573 }
00574 
00575 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00576 
00577 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00578 
00579     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00580 }
00581 
00582 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00583 
00584 {
00585     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00586                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00587                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00588                                      NULL,
00589                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00590 }
00591 
00592 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00593 
00594 {
00595     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00596                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00597                                      NULL,
00598                                      NULL,
00599                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00600 }

00602 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00603 
00604 {
00605     unsigned long flags = adeos_critical_enter(NULL);
00606     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00607 }
00608 
00609 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */

00611 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00612 
00613     return 0;
00614 }
00615 
00616 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00617 
00618     return 0;
00619 }
00620 
00621 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00622 
00623     return 0;
00624 }
00625 
00626 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00627 
00628 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00629 
00630 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00631 
00632 {
00633 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00634     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00635        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00636     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00637 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00638 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00639     xnshadow_release_events();
00640 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00641     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00642     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00643     schedule_timeout(50);
00644     xnarch_release_ipi();
00645 }
00646 
00647 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00648 
00649 {
00650     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00651 
00652     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00653         {
00654         spl_t s;
00655         splsync(s);
00656         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00657         splexit(s);
00658         return 1;
00659         }
00660 
00661     return 0;
00662 }
00663 
00664 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00665 
00666 {
00667 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00668     xnshadow_grab_events();
00669 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00670 }
00671 
00672 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00673 
00674 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00675 
00676 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00677                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00678                                            const char *name)
00679 {
00680     struct task_struct *task = current;
00681 
00682     tcb->user_task = task;
00683     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00684     tcb->ksp = 0;
00685     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00686 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00687     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00688 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00689     tcb->entry = NULL;
00690     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00691     tcb->self = thread;
00692     tcb->imask = 0;
00693     tcb->name = name;
00694 }
00695 
00696 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00697 
00698 {
00699     unsigned irq;
00700 
00701     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00702         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00703                              handler,
00704                              NULL,
00705                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00706 
00707     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00708        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00709        individually. */
00710 
00711     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00712                          handler,
00713                          NULL,
00714                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00715 }
00716 
00717 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00718 
00719 {
00720     unsigned irq;
00721 
00722     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00723         {
00724         switch (irq)
00725             {
00726 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00727             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00728 
00729                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00730                 continue;
00731 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00732 
00733             default:
00734 
00735                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00736             }
00737         }
00738 
00739     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00740 }
00741 
00742 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00743 
00744 {
00745     unsigned irq;
00746 
00747     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00748         {
00749         switch (irq)
00750             {
00751 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00752             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00753 
00754                 continue;
00755 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00756 
00757             default:
00758 
00759                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00760             }
00761         }
00762 
00763     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00764 }
00765 
00766 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00767 
00768 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00769 
00770 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00771     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00772        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough for
00773        now. If a timer need more, a spurious but harmless call to the tick
00774        handler will occur after 4 billions ticks. Since the timebase value is
00775        used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC port, there is no need to
00776        rescale the delay value. */
00777     rthal_set_timer_shot(delay);
00778 }
00779 
00780 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00781     rthal_release_timer();
00782 }
00783 
00784 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00785 
00786 {
00787 #if CONFIG_SMP
00788     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00789 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00790     return 0;
00791 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00792 }
00793 
00794 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00795                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00796                                         unsigned long long defval)
00797 {
00798 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00799     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00800     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00801     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00802 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00803     *shot = defval;
00804     *delivery = defval;
00805 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00806 }
00807 
00808 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00815 
00816 {
00817     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00818     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00819     hcb->heapbase = NULL;
00820     hcb->shmbase = NULL;

00823 static inline int xnarch_remap_page_range(struct vm_area_struct *vma,
00824                                           unsigned long uvaddr,
00825                                           unsigned long paddr,
00826                                           unsigned long size,
00827                                           pgprot_t prot)
00828 {
00829     return remap_pfn_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr >> PAGE_SHIFT,size,prot);
00830 }

00833 
00834 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00835 
00836 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00837 
00838 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00839 
00840 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00841 
00842 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00843 
00844 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00845 
00846 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00847 
00848 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00849 
00850 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00851 
00852 {
00853     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00854     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00855     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00856 }
00857 
00858 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00859 
00860 {
00861 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00862     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00863 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00864     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00865        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00866     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer()) ?: 1;
00867 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00868 }
00869 
00870 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00871 
00872 {
00873     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00874 
00875     if (!nktimerlat)
00876         return -ENODEV;
00877 
00878     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00879 
00880     return 0;
00881 }
00882 
00883 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00884 
00885 {
00886     int err;
00887 
00888 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00889     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00890        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00891     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00892 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00893 
00894     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00895 
00896     if (err)
00897         return err;
00898 
00899     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00900 
00901     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00902         return -ENOSYS;
00903 
00904     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00905                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00906                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00907                               NULL,
00908                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00909 
00910     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00911 
00912 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00913     err = xnshadow_mount();
00914 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00915 
00916     if (err)
00917         {
00918         rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00919         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00920         }
00921 
00922     return err;
00923 }
00924 
00925 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00926 
00927 {
00928 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00929     xnshadow_cleanup();
00930 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00931     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00932     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00933 }
00934 
00935 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00936 
00937 #ifdef __cplusplus
00938 }
00939 #endif

00947 #define xnarch_post_graph_if(obj,state,cond)
